snippet.textDisplay: The "Rave" was most likely started because of how JRPGs work -- you have the "now entering battle mode" animation, and then a panning view of the battlefield, perhaps a few words exchanged as the characters appear on the battlefield....and THEN the battle starts. The music is usually timed so that the "IT IS ON" starts playing just as you gain control of your first character.
snippet.textOriginal: The "Rave" was most likely started because of how JRPGs work -- you have the "now entering battle mode" animation, and then a panning view of the battlefield, perhaps a few words exchanged as the characters appear on the battlefield....and THEN the battle starts. The music is usually timed so that the "IT IS ON" starts playing just as you gain control of your first character.

snippet.textDisplay: You sure he goes back in time, or do you think he dies? After all, Alice is already dead. As for the paradox, it will only be there, as soon as Karen is born in Germany, which  means there's still time to get her out of there. With all the crazy shit that's been in the games, anything can happen, including Yuri getting his soul back. I am not expecting SH4 either, but its wishful thinking. I do have all games though, incl Koudelka.

snippet.textDisplay: In the good ending, he goes back in time to relive his memories. In the bad ending, he doesn't forget his memories, they are destroyed, along with his soul. Also, whichever ending they choose, the paradox will still be there, which might be why they left Yuri completely, just had some of the characters left. And there will probably not be any more shadow hearts games. Better to play them all again, starting with: Koudelka
snippet.textOriginal: In the good ending, he goes back in time to relive his memories. In the bad ending, he doesn't forget his memories, they are destroyed, along with his soul. snippet.textDisplay:
Very true, but in one of the endings, Yuri goes back to be with Alice, in the other, he forgets his memory, which can still be restored.

Considering it would be a time paradox if Karen would be Yuri's mother, considering Karen would also be born around that time, I highly doubt, if there's ever a Shadow Hearts 4, that they'd get away with that story.
snippet.textOriginal:
Very true, but in one of the endings, Yuri goes back to be with Alice, in the other, he forgets his memory, which can still be restored.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm only calling people liars if they make up stories too farfetched to be believable, or simply claim things without backing them up.

Aside, Yuri's element has always been dark, it never changed. You just want Killer to be Yuri too much that you'd even go as far as claiming to be family.

snippet.textDisplay:
I like to believ she settled with his father, because that was the only way she was going to be with Yuri. Yuri says it in the game that his mother always cried when she looked at him, because she still loved Yuri.

As for the bad endings, not necessarily. SH2 took the bad ending from SH1, I am not sure what ending SH3 took. I personally hope the bad ending is chosen, as that, at least leaves Karen into the frame. Anyway, they don't automatically pick the bad ending, just SH2 as far as I know.

snippet.textDisplay:
It is easy to say that. Lemmie guess, you don't have proof you're related to said person either?

There is no hint in the game that Yuri and Killer are related. Yay, they look similar... apart from that they have a different haircolour and Yuri's element is Dark and not Fire, which Killer has.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I don't expect you to believe me. I get that a lot *laughs*. But if what you want is a written source, then I really can't help you there. I'm just telling you Hirota's point of view, based on what he's heard on the crew and his own opinion (at least that's what he told me). We got to talking when I went for a visit in Osaka and he really didn't tell me much. I just met him at that time and Japanese people aren't really that open when it comes to first time encounters.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't expect you to believe me. I get that a lot *laughs*. But if what you want is a written source, then I really can't help you there. I'm just telling you Hirota's point of view, based on what he's heard on the crew and his own opinion (at least that's what he told me). We got to talking when I went for a visit in Osaka and he really didn't tell me much. I just met him at that time and Japanese people aren't really that open when it comes to first time encounters.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, OK. Good enough. I guess you can say that the story has a lot of ways that you can interpret it. It's good to know every opinion and point of view from different players around the world.
snippet.textOriginal: Well, OK. Good enough. I guess you can say that the story has a lot of ways that you can interpret it. It's good to know every opinion and point of view from different players around the world.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh yeah, of course I believe that. Now give me a source where it is written by the person himself.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh yeah, of course I believe that. Now give me a source where it is written by the person himself.

snippet.textDisplay:
No, not really. She fell in love with Yuri, but Yuri didn't was in love with Alice, who kept coming back from the dead, the greedy woman she is.
Karin loved Yuri so much, that all she wanted to be was at Yuri's side when the world was being destroyed. Because Yuri wanted to be somewhere else, Karin ended being his mother and later on die, due to that attack on his house.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Karin loves Yuri. She tells him, and it's not even necessary cause' it even shows throughout the game. But if you think about it carefully, she really loved him like a mother loves her child. She didn't really know that, of course.

snippet.textDisplay: I have played all the games, hence I said the ending of SH2 was horrible. Alice is dead, get over it. Now, Karen who loved Yuri so much is forced into her being his mother. What a pain. The burden of loving your son as if he was your lover. Remember when Yuri sat on the bench and said he was named after his mother's first lover? Oh the cruelty. Man, what a horrible, horrible ending to a great game.
snippet.textOriginal: I have played all the games, hence I said the ending of SH2 was horrible. Alice is dead, get over it. Now, Karen who loved Yuri so much is forced into her being his mother. What a pain. The burden of loving your son as if he was your lover. Remember when Yuri sat on the bench and said he was named after his mother's first lover? Oh the cruelty. Man, what a horrible, horrible ending to a great game.

snippet.textDisplay: (Last reply, don't get anxious!)Unfortunately, Yuri took a wrong path and became the bad guy in SH3, known as Killer. So if you see, it's a cool storyline. snippet.textDisplay: (Reply continued). She becomes his wife and they have Yuri as their son. Karin changes her name to Anne (Anastasia changed her legal papers, legally naming her Anne and a Russian). People that have played SH2 until the end know this. And in SH3, the story continues because what really died was Yuri's counsciousness and soul; this left in the world a body with no memory at all. (Continued in the next and last reply).
snippet.textOriginal: (Reply continued). She becomes his wife and they have Yuri as their son. Karin changes her name to Anne (Anastasia changed her legal papers, legally naming her Anne and a Russian). People that have played SH2 until the end know this. And in SH3, the story continues because what really died was Yuri's counsciousness and soul; this left in the world a body with no memory at all. (Continued in the next and last reply).

snippet.textDisplay: I personally think you're wrong. You see, every Shadow Hearts game has 2 endings (good and bad), right? But here's the thing: the real endings are the bad ones. In SH1, Alice dies and the story in the second game continues with that. In SH2, Yuri dies and Karin goes into the past and meets with Yuri's father. (Continued in my next reply).
snippet.textOriginal: I personally think you're wrong. You see, every Shadow Hearts game has 2 endings (good and bad), right? But here's the thing: the real endings are the bad ones. In SH1, Alice dies and the story in the second game continues with that. In SH2, Yuri dies and Karin goes into the past and meets with Yuri's father. (Continued in my next reply).

snippet.textDisplay: You HAVE to play the first 2 Shadow Hearts games to fully understand the storyline. Also, be sure to watch the Shadow Hearts 2 ending completely (including the scene after the credits roll).
snippet.textOriginal: You HAVE to play the first 2 Shadow Hearts games to fully understand the storyline. Also, be sure to watch the Shadow Hearts 2 ending completely (including the scene after the credits roll).

snippet.textDisplay:
They certainly passed it off that way in the sequel. In the game itself, they were pretty explicit about calling it the Creator God of Judeo-Christian mythology.

My guess is that it was supposed to be the Demiurge (the false, imperfect creator deity) that is referred to in the more unorthodox branches of said mythology.
snippet.textOriginal:
They certainly passed it off that way in the sequel. In the game itself, they were pretty explicit about calling it the Creator God of Judeo-Christian mythology.

My guess is that it was supposed to be the Demiurge (the false, imperfect creator deity) that is referred to in the more unorthodox branches of said mythology.
